alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 12:17PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Kauai in Kauai County. * WHEN...Until 315 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1213 PM HST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain over the northeast portion of Kauai. The heaviest rain was falling between Wailua and Anahola at a rate of 1 to 3 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kapaa, Princeville, Kilauea, Wailua, Anahola, Moloaa, Hanalei, Wainiha, Haena, Wailua River State Park, Kealia, Hanamaulu and Puhi. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 315 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown. A Flood Watch is also in effect for the island of Kauai until 6 AM HST Wednesday.
